fields.description:
Backlog Board quick filter clear button does not clear the filter.

Steps to reproduce:

Open a Scrum Board and go to the backlog.

Regardless of selected quick filters or not, start typing on the search field. 

The button to *Clear* the search will be there but it will appear at not selectable (the cursor will change to field text select).

Reproduced in several JIRA Cloud instance.

Workaround:

Using the keyboard to clear the quick filter search.

Thank you.
fields.summary: Backlog Board quick filter clear button does not clear the filter

fields.description: Switching between views like "My open issues", "All issues", "Reported by me" etc, seems to reset the filters selected. It would be nice to switch between above views without having to re-specify the filter from scratch after each change.
fields.summary: On Search Issue page, allow switching views while preserving flters

fields.description:
Allow Select-All on filter values. This will make easy an "All-Except" kind of situations. So if I wanted all the statuses except Closed and Resolved, I would not have to individually mark the many statuses. Instead I could select all and then unselect Closed and Resolved.

I suppose Unselect All goes in parallel to Select-All

fields.summary: Make it possible to change the name of issue type "Epic" in Cloud Jira

fields.description:
Hello:

I create the space for translating the Asterisk doc from English into Chinese. the HTML format exported by exported tool works well, but I try to export my doc in PDF format, the PDF exported still in english version.
fields.summary: Can not export the PDF in Chinese

fields.description: Currently the bitbucket.org interface only allows you to filter EITHER active OR merged branches. Please consider changing it so that both can be filtered into the same view. I found it confusing/unintuitive as a new Bitbucket user.
fields.summary: Allow users to filter in both "active" and "merged" branches into a single view.

fields.description: ">

*Summary*

At the moment, the Create User and Bulk Create pages were recently merged.

*Suggestion*

It would be great having back both options for creating new users (Bulk create users and Single create user). As an admin, I need to fill the user's full name and username.
fields.summary: Split back create users buttons (Bulk Create User and Single Create User)
Allow opt-out of social agenda site settings, e.g. gay pride month, Christian holidays, etc.

fields.description:
THE TASK:

Assume Paypal has an API we can automatically integrate, with aslong as we can send them the appropriate parameters they need. Produce specs/requirements documents defining any changes you would make to Admin System and/or Apps to address the problems. These specs will be given directly to the development teams.

h3. Steps to reproduce
 - Admin has the Domain verified in the instance
 - Navigate through the User Management
 - Try to update the user's full name of a user that is currently set as private.
 - User management shows the message "successfully updated."
 - The changes were not accepted

h3. Expected Result

Admin would receive an error such as "The Atlassian Account is a "private" account so we can't update the user's details", and full name change fails.
h3. Actual Result

Admin receives "successfully update" message, but the user's changes don't change.
fields.summary: Verified domain instances, admins change user's full name of a private user, receive "Successfully updated" yet the changes were not accepted

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If I add a TOC macro to the sidebar the links do not work

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install Confluence 5.9.12 or Confluence 5.10.1
# Create a page with some headings
# Go to Space Tools>Look and Feel>sidebar, header and footer
# Paste this into the sidebar field:
{code}{toc:maxLevel=2|style=disc|indent=10px|absoluteURL=false}{code}
or even simply
{code}{toc}{code}

h3. Expected Results
The links from the TOC would lead to the headings on the page
h3. Actual Results
An invalid URL is created by the links in the sidebar. Please see attached screenshots showing the TOC URLs created by:
* clicking on a TOC macro link in a page
!TOCpageURL5.10.1.png|thumbnail!
!TOCpageURL5.9.12.png|thumbnail!
compared to
* clicking on a TOC macro link in the sidebar
!TOCsidebarURL5.10.1.png|thumbnail!
!TOCsidebarURL5.9.12.png|thumbnail!

h3.Workaround
There is no workaround.
fields.summary: TOC macro in sidebar creates invalid URL
Need to resolve bugs in XYZ porject

fields.description:
From time to time customers are having to disconnect from G Suite and reconnect due to errors in the sync between Cloud and G Suite.  Whenever the account is reconnected, an email goes out to all users stating that the Administrator had made changes, which confuses end users.

 

Customers would like to have the ability to turn off this email entirely after the first time they've connected.
fields.summary: Ability to disable G Suite integration email.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
An error message saying "Sorry, something went wrong. Your changes are not being saved" when trying to hide an entry in Application Navigator

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to application navigator configuration of your instance
# Click on hide checkbox for the entry you wish to hide
# Click on the textbox to determine restrictions to which group

h3. Expected Results
No error message thrown

h3. Actual Results
The error message shown (check attachment)
 
h3. Notes
The list of groups will be shown, but the error message is causing some confusion.

h3.Workaround
-
fields.summary: "Sorry, something went wrong. Your changes are not being saved." when trying to hide an entry in Application Navigator

fields.description:
The mail Space permission shows in Confluence.   This is something that is not in our Cloud Confluence documentation [Space Permissions Overview|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/space-permissions-overview-724764760.html].  This links to [Deleting Mail|https://confluence.atlassian.com/conf55/confluence-user-s-guide/organising-content/working-with-mail-archives/deleting-mail] which is only available in pre 5.6 Confluence documentation.

fields.description:
After *Collaborative Editing* was enabled, the *save* functionality was no longer required, as this is done automatically. However, when customers navigate to *Help > Keyboard Shortcuts > Editor*, it is still showing as if *⌘+S* saved the page as draft.

This has caused confusion to some customers, as they are publishing drafts without knowing by using this shortcut, which now causes the page to be published.

Please either remove this shortcut from the help tab.

Current information:
Save       ⌘+S
fields.summary: Fix on Help > Keyboard Shortcuts Tab

fields.description:
For the entire token-based OAuth dance, be sure to send the OAuth fields in the Query String. Accessing and/or manipulating Confluence data (via GET, PUT, etc.), the OAuth fields should always be in the QueryString (GET).

- [https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Answers-Developer-Questions/OAuth-In-Confluence/qaq-p/564870]

- [https://developer.atlassian.com/display/JIRADEV/JIRA+REST+API+Example+-+OAuth+authentication?_ga=2.154261432.1477734265.1496670597-1957517966.1485536647]
Currently, users can be added from Bitbucket's global user pool. Allow us to restrict users that can be added to our team, such as “Only users with email address @ourcompany.com can be added
fields.summary: Restrict users that can be added to our Bitbucket Cloud Team

fields.description: Allow premium Whitelisting IP Addresses feature to work with ssh keys. ([https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/control-access-to-your-private-content-862621261.html#Controlaccesstoyourprivatecontent-ip_whitelistingWhitelistingIPaddresses)]
fields.summary: Allow premium Whitelisting IP Addresses feature to work with ssh keys

Hi!

Thank you!

fields.description:
*Summary*

At the moment, when the admin performs the domain claim, this action send a notification to all users under the domain.

 !Mass Notification.JPG|thumbnail! 

*Suggestion*

As an admin, it would be great to have the ability to disable this notification or at least select a group of users who will receive that notification.
fields.summary: Ability to disable the domain claim notifications to all users under the domain

fields.description: Tweak JIRA components to suit project requirements.

*Current behavior:*  

When clicking the "Read more >>" link in the activity tab, it leads back to the top of the page because it is only linking the own issue.

!Screen Shot 2017-04-26 at 12.34.35 PM.png|thumbnail!  

*Expected behavior:*

The remaining text that is hidden will extend displaying all the text content. 

 

*Impact:*

Isn't possible to track the content changes.

 

*Workaround:*

There is no workaround available.
fields.summary: "Read more..."hyperlink for Activity on an Issue not viewable

fields.description:
For Bitbucket groups, it would be nice to have a team permission that enables the creation of repositories, but requires those repositories to be private.   

!image-2017-05-31-09-59-20-008.png|width=546,height=303!

If a user is in multiple groups, and one of the groups includes the ability to make public repositories, then the ability to create public repositories should override the private setting.  For instance, let's create an Admin group which can create repositories (public or private) and a Company group which can only create private repositories.

A user in the Admin group can create both public and private repositories.

A user in the Company group can create only private repositories, and cannot promote the the repository to public w/out the assistance of an Admin.

If a user is in both the Admin group and the Company group, the user should be able to make public and private repositories.
fields.summary: Bitbucket Cloud Add User Group Setting to Force Private Repositories

fields.description:
If you have G-suite integration set-up another instance. All users under that domain are forced to use Google to sign-up. This means you cannot create identities that are not actually a google account but are under your domain.

Think about the situation where we want to make management/admin accounts that do not exist in Google but we want to make one account easy to remember like, admin@yourcompany.com

*Suggested resolution*
Provide a solution (a simple checkbox would do it) for that account override Google SSO enforcement.
fields.summary: Allow usage of non-google accounts when G-suite is on.
In Service Desk, the screen title is Customers when it should be Organizations

fields.description:
*Steps to reproduce*
 - Admin with Domain verified instance that changed domain names and or has 2 verified/claimed domains.
 - Admin is not able to change email from "[user@domainA.com|mailto:user@domainA.com]" to "[user@domainB.com|mailto:user@domainB.com]" or "[user1@domain.com|mailto:user1@domain.com]" to "[user2@domain.com|mailto:user2@domain.com]"  , because there is already an atlassian account for the email for the user in question, however, User management shows the message "you have successfully changed the email address" or "successfully updated."

 

*Expected Result*

Admin would receive an error such as "An Atlassian account with "user@domainA.com" already exists so we can't update the email", and email change fails. Possibly with a link to Atlassian support because this case sucks. =D

 

*Actual Result*
 Admin receives "successfully update" message, but the email doesn't change.

 

Example Support Case: [https://getsupport.atlassian.com/browse/JST-287051]
fields.summary: Verified domain instances, admins change user's email, receive "Successfully updated" yet the changes were not accepted

If we use short title names for new people they are unreadable

The subtitle can be displayed on the document tree page and helps navigate

fields.description:
We are service company we have our own JIRA instance in the cloud, but when we work on a projects where customer provides their own JIRA in the cloud. It becomes really difficult to work with two (and more) instances in the cloud. Working with 2 different browsers for each instance is not an option. 

It will be perfect if I can login with the same browser to both JIRA instances.
fields.summary: Allow multiple accounts to use the cloud instances

fields.description:
A page showing a saved filter should display its full name as much as the space allows, rather than truncating after 30-odd characters.

Hovering the mouse cursor over it to see the full title seems like it should break a UX guideline, as the title is the crucial piece of identifying information for that filter, and not a secondary/expansionary piece of information
fields.summary: Customer would like to be able to see the whole filter name when there's space
login: why am I obliged to use my google email adres and can I not use the jira login?

fields.description:
Add-on: JIRA Cloud for Slack (Official) - [Link to marketplace|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.jira.slack/cloud/overview]

As a user, I would like to have the option to set my notifications to be filtered by choosing labels on the {{/jira manage}} screen. Currently, there's the option to filter by *Issue type* and *Priority*
fields.summary: Ability to sort JIRA notifications to Slack by using labels

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The link on the instances footer is https://answers.atlassian.com/ instead of https://community.atlassian.com/.

h3. Environment
JIRA v1000.929.2

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Enter in the instance and look to the footer area.

h3. Expected Results
Community link instead of Answers.

h3.Workaround
No need, answers automatically redirects to community.
fields.summary: Footer linking to Answers instead of Community

fields.description:
Currently Space exports are a real threat to our IP security.

People can export business sensitive information without us knowing about it.

We would like to restrict export of content to system admins only and not anymore for regular users.
fields.summary: Restrict Export to System Admins only

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Our current documentation on one hand states that all Bitbucket Cloud users have an Atlassian account. However in the next sentence states soon users will be able to login to additional cloud products with the same account. This can be confusing as it's unclear wether this refers to SAML or the Atlasssian Account. 

Please see [Upgrade the Atlassian account|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/the-upgrade-to-atlassian-account-873871204.html].
h3. Suggested Solution
Clearly delineate the functionality of the current Bitbucket Atlassian Cloud account. 
 
h3. Why this is important
 This causes unnecessary friction as it can be confused with SAML.
fields.summary: Define Bitbucket vs Atlassian Cloud SAML functionality.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In Firefox when you open a ticket's detail view, and you hover the transition/action buttons at the top of the ticket, the mouse cursor is displayed as a *text selection* instead of a hand/pointer.

h3. Environment
Firefox 53.0 (64-bit)
JIRA v1000.929.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Using Firefox 53, open a JIRA ticket;
# Hover over the transition buttons.

h3. Expected Results
Pointer/Hand mouse icon

h3. Notes
What the [Mozilla docs say about "cursor: auto"|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/cursor]:
{quote}The browser determines the cursor to display based on the current context.
E.g. equivalent to text when hovering text.{quote}
 
!firefox.png|thumbnail! 

For comparison, in Chrome when hovering it appears as a Hand.

h3.Workaround
fields.summary: Mouse cursor appears as "text selection" when hovering transition buttons (Firefox)

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently Export users button is disable in User Management

h3. Suggested Solution
Please enable it 

h3. Why this is important
It is important for a lot of customers as they depend on the report for auditing purposes
